UnitType.Description: Black Widows are the most common of the Great Spiders and are often found in forests and ruins. These creatures paralyze their prey and drain them of their blood before discarding the remains amongst their drones.

GameModifier.Provides: -1% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Backstory: Black Widows are the most common of the Great Spiders and are often found in forests and ruins. These creatures paralyze their prey and drain them of their blood before discarding the remains amongst their drones.

UnitType.Description: Native to the high mountain reaches, the cave bear is one of the largest - and deadliest - creatures in all the world. Some believe these animals evolved naturally; others believe that they were bred by Morrigan in the depths of N'it'Vaganesh. Despite (or perhaps because of) their size, there are numerous recorded instances of these bears being trapped when young and subsequently raised as servants. They are quite trainable, albeit very destructive.

GameModifier.Provides: -1% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Backstory: Native to the high mountain reaches, the cave bear is one of the largest - and deadliest - creatures in all the world. Some believe these animals evolved naturally; others believe that they were bred by Morrigan in the depths of N'it'Vaganesh. Despite (or perhaps because of) their size, there are numerous recorded instances of these bears being trapped when young and subsequently raised as servants. They are quite trainable, albeit very destructive.

UnitType.Description: These are the eldest and most powerful of their kind - those who lead the pack. Larger in size, more cunning, more intelligent, and by some accounts, far more aggressive.

GameModifier.Provides: -1% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Backstory: These are the eldest and most powerful of their kind - those who lead the pack. Larger in size, more cunning, more intelligent, and by some accounts, far more aggressive.

UnitType.Description: A monster not unlike a boar, the hergon is often hunted for its meat and (to the right market) valuable tusks. Naturally aggressive, the hergon has a predilection for charging at their attackers (which is probably you and your minions). Hunters of hergons often use ranged attacks or mounted soldiers to avoid being knocked down.

GameModifier.Provides: -1% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Backstory: A monster not unlike a boar, the hergon is often hunted for its meat and (to the right market) valuable tusks. Naturally aggressive, the hergon has a predilection for charging at their attackers (which is probably you and your minions). Hunters of hergons often use ranged attacks or mounted soldiers to avoid being knocked down.

UnitType.Description: Reclusive, defensive, brutally powerful, this monster is extremely territorial and violently aggressive. Hoarder Spiders are drawn to objects possessed of great arcane power; they often make their lairs near such relics to protect them.

GameModifier.Provides: -1% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Backstory: Reclusive, defensive, brutally powerful, this monster is extremely territorial and violently aggressive. Hoarder Spiders are drawn to objects possessed of great arcane power; they often make their lairs near such relics to protect them.

UnitType.Description: No serpent hates men as much as these, for the Naja were bred within N'it'Vaganesh as living weapons. They can grow to three times a man's length, with fangs as long and sharp as short swords. Yet it is the Naja's venom that is its most deadly weapon. The poison is so toxic that even a glancing strike causes near-instant necrosis, killing all flesh around the bite radius; if even a single drop enters the bloodstream, fatality follows.

GameModifier.Provides: -1% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Backstory: No serpent hates men as much as these, for the Naja were bred within N'it'Vaganesh as living weapons. They can grow to three times a man's length, with fangs as long and sharp as short swords. Yet it is the Naja's venom that is its most deadly weapon. The poison is so toxic that even a glancing strike causes near-instant necrosis, killing all flesh around the bite radius; if even a single drop enters the bloodstream, fatality follows.

UnitType.Description: Sages say the Ophidian were once great pythons, related to the bonefield morelia, but they were changed after generations of nesting near crystal deposits. Those crystals became embedded in their scales. The Ophidian are now over twice as long as their ancestors, and immune to spells. Their bite causes a feeling of numbness and euphoria in the victim; a sensation that helps numb the horror of being swallowed whole.

GameModifier.Provides: -1% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Backstory: Sages say the Ophidian were once great pythons, related to the bonefield morelia, but they were changed after generations of nesting near crystal deposits. Those crystals became embedded in their scales. The Ophidian are now over twice as long as their ancestors, and immune to spells. Their bite causes a feeling of numbness and euphoria in the victim; a sensation that helps numb the horror of being swallowed whole.

UnitType.Description: The Silt Skath is found exclusively in and around river deltas. It tends to partially bury itself in the mud of the riverbed, waiting patiently for spawning ocean fish to enter the river from the sea.

GameModifier.Provides: -1% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Backstory: The Silt Skath is found exclusively in and around river deltas. It tends to partially bury itself in the mud of the riverbed, waiting patiently for spawning ocean fish to enter the river from the sea.

UnitType.Description: These great cats are solitary hunters, with an uncanny ability to target the weakest member within any group - be it wolf pack, trading caravan, or fighting army - and make a quick kill of them. Recall Erwynn's tale of the Princess's Pet, and the fate of Duke Prandir, who was chased across the deserts of Lombard to his death.

GameModifier.Provides: -3% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Backstory: These great cats are solitary hunters, with an uncanny ability to target the weakest member within any group - be it wolf pack, trading caravan, or fighting army - and make a quick kill of them. Recall Erwynn's tale of the Princess's Pet, and the fate of Duke Prandir, who was chased across the deserts of Lombard to his death.

UnitType.Description: Wargs are fell creatures, wolves mutated by dark magics thousands of years ago. They are stronger and more cunning than their non-magical counterparts. They prefer to hunt alone, and will fight over territory rather than ally themselves with their brethren.

GameModifier.Provides: -3% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Backstory: Wargs are fell creatures, wolves mutated by dark magics thousands of years ago. They are stronger and more cunning than their non-magical counterparts. They prefer to hunt alone, and will fight over territory rather than ally themselves with their brethren.

UnitType.Description: These were bred by the Lady Umber, in the time before this one, for use in those battles now known as the Umbran Wars. Some of these monsters survived the Cataclysm, and have now been captured and tamed by the great channelers of the East.

GameModifier.Provides: -1% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Backstory: These were bred by the Lady Umber, in the time before this one, for use in those battles now known as the Umbran Wars. Some of these monsters survived the Cataclysm, and have now been captured and tamed by the great channelers of the East.

GameModifier.Provides: -1% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Backstory: In the mountains of Urak, the storm giants long have dwelled. But now they walk abroad, carrying the strange construct of their homes with them, to defend those faithful to the mysterious, omnipresent air.

You are the Mountain and you worship Earth. Deep into the tunnels, covered in clay and dust, you've found your path. In the darkness, you've found light. And now you shall bring that darkness all over the surface.

You are of the Sacred Flame and you worship Fire. Empowered in unity, you shall spread across the lands and burn. Forest, flesh, even the hills themselves must be spent to blackness. Only then will the hungering tongues within rest, only when all the waters are fog and the lands are ash.

In the mountains of Urak, the storm giants long have dwelled. But now they walk abroad, carrying the strange construct of their homes with them, to defend those faithful to the mysterious, omnipresent air.

You are the Mountain and you worship Earth. Deep into the tunnels, covered in clay and dust, you've found your path. In the darkness, you've found light. And now you shall bring that darkness all over the surface.

You are of the Sacred Flame and you worship Fire. Empowered in unity, you shall spread across the lands and burn. Forest, flesh, even the hills themselves must be spent to blackness. Only then will the hungering tongues within rest, only when all the waters are fog and the lands are ash.

Within the catacombs of ruined Odenvell, Ceresa took dozens of these carnivorous spiders and bound them to her will. Study of the proper enchantments will enable those who are flesh of her flesh - those who the world calls Wraiths - to similarly enslave these deadly arachnids, and use them as weapons against their enemies.

Within the catacombs of ruined Odenvell, Ceresa took dozens of these carnivorous spiders and bound them to her will. Study of the proper enchantments will enable those who are flesh of her flesh - those who the world calls Wraiths - to similarly enslave these deadly arachnids, and use them as weapons against their enemies.

Within the catacombs of ruined Odenvell, Ceresa took dozens of these carnivorous spiders and bound them to her will. Study of the proper enchantments will enable those who are flesh of her flesh - those who the world calls Wraiths - to similarly enslave these deadly arachnids, and use them as weapons against their enemies.

UnitType.Description: Catapults are devastating on the battle field but are extremely slow and expensive. Their attacks damage all units within a 1 tile radius.
UnitType.Backstory: These machines are based upon drawings found in the great library at New Pariden. They are reconstructions of those catapults Argynn used thousands of years ago during the siege of Eduruun V'olloz - the black citadel of the Nerazga.
An animated heap of garbage, a sanitation construct, a refuse director of sort...

UnitType.Description: Sions are the most skilled warriors of the fallen. Though they can't learn magic they gain levels and traits as champions.
Sions are the most skilled warriors of the fallen. Though they can't learn magic they gain levels and traits as champions.

UnitType.Backstory:
There's an old folk saying that comes in handy when pointing out someone's foolishness: "go ahead and follow the Will O' Wisp to your doom". Mysterious creatures, these shimmering balls of swamp gas are believed to be the souls of the wicked, promising a safe journey through deceitful swamps only to lead those travelers foolish enough to trust them to a gruesome end, condemning their souls to remain on this plane as newly born Will O'Wisps. Others postulate they are agents of the Air Lords with an inscrutable agenda, alien minds communicating through shifting lights impossible to decipher for the untrained eye. Surely you can trust this benevolent spirit? Maybe... but you should keep in mind that swamp gas has explosive properties and can blow up in your face without notice.
Despite not having a body, Will O'Wisps are spirits capable of holding together a set of armor and even ride mounts! However, doing so links their spirit to the armor and mount. They will die if the puppet is destroyed.

These Wisps have been set on fire by dark magic. Or maybe it was just someone taking advantage of the fact they're balls of swamp gas!
Despite not having a body, Fire Wisps are spirits capable of holding together a set of armor and even ride mounts! However, doing so links their spirit to the armor and mount. They will die if the puppet is destroyed.

UnitType.Description: Archers are lightly equipped and skilled at picking off their opponents at a distance.
Defenders are formidable troops that are able to outlast enemy units and absorb lots of damage.
A spearman is effective against well armored enemies.
Archers are lightly equipped and skilled at picking off their opponents at a distance.
Caravans boost your economy by allowing merchants in your cities to trade goods with each other.
Bards level and use equipment like champions. They can learn basic air and water spells and improve the rate the army they are in gains experience.
Bards level and use equipment like champions. They can learn basic air and water spells and improve the rate the army they are in gains experience.
Shieldmen level and use equipment like champions. They can learn basic earth spells and help defend the armies they are in.
Shieldmen level and use equipment like champions. They can learn basic earth spells and help defend the armies they are in.
Torch Bearers level and use equipment like champions. They can learn basic fire and life spells and improve the healing of the army they are in.
Torch Bearers level and use equipment like champions. They can learn basic fire and death.
Torch Bearers level and use equipment like champions. They can learn basic fire and life spells and improve the healing of the army they are in.
Henchmen level and can use equipment like champions, but don't divide experience.
Henchmen level and can use equipment like champions, but don't divide experience.
There are few creatures on Elemental that are able to withstand more damage than an Iron Golem. Long have they stood silent, patient sentry over their charges.
UnitType.Backstory: These are creatures forged of mana and metal; beings who can be summoned into existence only by those possessing the blood of the Aivernach - the Iron Tribes of old. An Iron Golem can wield any weapon given to it, and is a master of defense; long after the last men of Aivern fell to the hordes of Meergas Maz Adul's Nerazga, its Iron Golems remained, stalwart protectors of the city walls.

UnitType.Description: Nothing matches the savagery of a Juggernaut. Your enemies should be afraid, but your allies are also at risk from the Juggernaut's frenzied attacks.
UnitType.Backstory: "Feel no pain. Know no fear. Need no rest. Fight till the foe falls. Then seek the next battle." These are the watchwords of the yatra nata - the Juggernauts - the elite among all Trog warriors, soldiers segregated from their brethren on their eleventh name day for special training. History says their first battle came a dozen years after the Quendar conquered Teroth-Nu, when eight of them overthrew a city full of Magnar II's troops, and retook Kir-Tion's throne.

UnitType.Description: Nothing matches the savagery of a Juggernaut. Your enemies should be afraid, but your allies are also at risk from the Juggernaut's frenzied attacks.

UnitType.Description:
Within the third quarto of the Varis Reliquaria is contained the spell Anima Tsal Animana - life from lifelessness. This incantation, first mastered by Ereog in his time of solitude, imbues stone with the semblance of life.
When a Klay Golem is destroyed it reverts back to the rock and sand it was prior to enchantment.

UnitType.Description: Sages say the Ophidian were once great pythons, related to the bonefield morelia, but they were changed after generations of nesting near crystal deposits. Those crystals became embedded in their scales. The Ophidian are now over twice as long as their ancestors, and immune to spells. Their bite causes a feeling of numbness and euphoria in the victim; a sensation that helps numb the horror of being swallowed whole.

UnitType.Description: A peasant armed with a crude club.
UnitType.Backstory: Ages ago, when the legions of Antheros fell to the Quendar, Magnar II enslaved the soldiers of that once-great nation, forcing them to serve in the advance guard of his army. Since that day, the Quendar have made it a practice to not only enslave the conquered masses of their foes, but to forcibly 'enlist' them as foot soldiers. They are little more than cannon fodder, if truth be told - fed, clothed, and armed with the most meager essentials.

UnitType.Description: A peasant armed with a crude club.
UnitType.Backstory: Ages ago, when the legions of Antheros fell to the Quendar, Magnar II enslaved the soldiers of that once-great nation, forcing them to serve in the advance guard of his army. Since that day, the Quendar have made it a practice to not only enslave the conquered masses of their foes, but to forcibly 'enlist' them as foot soldiers. They are little more than cannon fodder, if truth be told - fed, clothed, and armed with the most meager essentials.

UnitType.Description: Vampires move and attack with frightening speed. They can also teleport and suck the blood of their enemies. However, their dislike of fire is so strong that they will refuse to make use of any fire-based equipment.
UnitType.Backstory:
"We are the eternal. So long as we pay the price of our eternal animation, we shall watch and rule for eternity."
-Code of the Nosferatus Imiaris

UnitType.Description: Vampires move and attack with frightening speed. They can also teleport and suck the blood of their enemies. However, their dislike of fire is so strong that they will refuse to make use of any fire-based equipment.
UnitType.Backstory:
"We are the eternal. So long as we pay the price of our eternal animation, we shall watch and rule for eternity."
-Code of the Nosferatus Imiaris

UnitType.Description: Creatures said to be born of a mad mage's dream to mate men and wolves. Unfortunately for her, her dream came true. Combining the speed and strength of wolves with the dexterity (and opposable thumbs) of men, werewolves can close the distance and proceed to slaughter their enemies with ease. Due to their semi-wolf nature, they have an inherent dislike of fire, and as such, refuse to wield or wear any fire based equipment. Too bad that mage never got the chance to fix that.
